responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure Download and Extraction of Archive in Install Script
    analysis: |
      The install script provided for manually installing Microsoft.NETCore.App 1.0.1 on Linux systems directly downloads an archive from a given URL using curl and extracts it to system directories. This process lacks any form of checksum verification or integrity validation which can lead to security risks such as a Man-in-the-Middle attack. An attacker can intercept the download request and provide a malicious archive, leading to arbitrary code execution on the system where the script is run.
    cwe: CWE-494
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - release-notes/1.0/install-1.0.1.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure Download and Extraction of Archive in Install Script
leads.analysis: The install script provided for manually installing Microsoft.NETCore.App 1.0.1 on Linux systems directly downloads an archive from a given URL using curl and extracts it to system directories. This process lacks any form of checksum verification or integrity validation which can lead to security risks such as a Man-in-the-Middle attack. An attacker can intercept the download request and provide a malicious archive, leading to arbitrary code execution on the system where the script is run.
